author: Jules Verne
description: A group of men escape imprisonment during the American Civil War by stealing a balloon.

author: Jane Austen
description: Traces the tumultuous relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian future where critical thought is suppressed under a totalitarian regime.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The story of millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the elusive Daisy Buchanan.

author: Herman Melville
description: The voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, commanded by Captain Ahab.

author: Leo Tolstoy
description: The narrative of five families through the Napoleonic Wars.

author: Aldous Huxley
description: A future society driven by technological advancements.

author: J.D. Salinger
description: A few days in the life of sixteen-year-old Holden Caulfield.

author: Harper Lee
description: The injustice of a black man charged with raping a white woman.

author: Homer
description: Odysseus' journey home after the fall of Troy.

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: A collection of stories featuring the world's greatest detective, Sherlock Holmes.

author: Mary Shelley
description: A tale of a scientist who creates a creature through an unorthodox scientific experiment.

author: Bram Stoker
description: The horror story of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A complex tale of love, family, politics, and religion in imperial Russia.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
description: A tale about a young prince who travels from planet to planet, meeting inhabitants and learning life lessons.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the town of Macondo.

author: Charles Dickens
description: A story set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.

author: Joseph Heller
description: The absurdity and horror of war as seen through the eyes of Captain John Yossarian.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The story of three brothers and their struggles with faith, doubt, and morality.

author: Emily Brontë
description: A tragic love story between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff set in the Yorkshire moors.
